column4: i have a problem, i have some stuff that says i have unmet dependencies when i go to install a program,  *i can't do a apt-get -f install* cause it says it's going to remove half the system.  how do i remove the items that have unmet dependincies instead?
what program ?
libc6-dev
any non ubuntu repositories in your sources.list ?
libc6-dev is the program with unmet depenencies
yea (accidently)  but i fixed it
i caut it pretty quick
maybe there kies your prob then
yea-  i know the problem. i want to fix it hehe
what alien repo did you have in your sources.lis ?
*a private one*  it was from a company i work for...
and did you use ubuntuguide to set up your os ?
i didn't set it up
so i don't know

if that makes any sense
